page.title: 16The Gypsy site, Lullington
page.content: The gypsy camp between Lullington and Coton is classed as a short stay site. For this reason the cost of an overnight stay increases from Â£1 in the first week to Â£2 in the following week. After spending 2 weeks at the site the gypsies have to leave. Gypsies visiting the site come from all parts of Great Britain. There tend to be slightly more caravans in the area in the winter. A gypsy warden and his family live permanently on the site. He ensures that the basic facilities (fresh water and toilets) are available. He also has to deal with any social problems between the local people and gypsies. No incident has needed police involvement to date but the gypsies were not welcomed in the area, a fact made worse by bad media coverage.
